answers.author: Laura Snideman
answers.text:
When the State of California imposes a new mandate on local government, agencies are allowed to submit "SB 90" claims and the State is supposed to reimburse us for the cost of implementation.  (The issues around this process are numerous but for a separate discussion.)  You might want to formulate a public records request to the State to see some examples of these claims and/or there several firms that help with submitting claims – I believe Maximus is one such firm – and they may be able to help with a methodology.

author: Cheryl Hilvert
text:
A colleague has asked if anyone is aware of any local governmetns who have evaluated and reported the cost of local/state/federal regulations to their budget?
Could anyone who has done any of this work or aware of other local governments who may have, please let us know.
Thanks.
title: Cost of Federal, State and Local Regulation on Budgets
